s1.name: Recent news
s1.subtitle: 10th june 2002: JORAM now implements the new JMS 1.1 specification!
s1.p: Joram 3.1.0 fully implements JMS 1.1 providing unified messaging interfaces for the Point-to-Point and Pub/Sub domains. In the previous versions of Joram and JMS, the client programming model made a strong distinction between these two domains. Now, the domain unification simplifies the model and allows to include PTP and Pub/Sub messaging in a same transaction.
No need to modify existing applications: code written for the previous Joram and JMS versions will work as is with these new versions.
s1.subtitle: 7th june 2002: JORAM 3.0.4 available (cvs tag: joram3_0_4-1)
s1.p: JORAM 3.0.4 is now available for download.

This version is a maintenance version of JORAM, it includes corrections of bugs in XA and ASF classes. The JORAM CVS repository has been branched after this release: next version of JORAM will implement JMS 1.1. The branch corresponding to JMS 1.0.2b is jms1_0_2b.
s1.subtitle: 26th March 2002: JORAM 3.0.1 available (cvs tag: joram3_0_1)
s1.p: JORAM 3.0.1 is now available for download.
This version corrects all bugs discovered by JORAM community since the release of JORAM 3.0.0. These corrections were already available in CVS repository.
s1.subtitle: 20th March 2002: JMS Test Suite released
s1.p:
A JMS Test Suite has been released under LGPL.
This suite tests JMS features. All code of the test suite is pure JMS without any dependency to JORAM.
All code is available from JORAM cvs repository. See the test suite documentation for more information.

s1.name: JORAM: Java (TM) Open Reliable Asynchronous Messaging
s1.p: JORAM incorporates a 100% pure Java implementation of JMS (Java Message Service API released by Sun Microsystem, Inc.). It provides access to a MOM (Message Oriented Middleware), built on top of the Scalagent agents based distributed platform. JORAM is a free, open source initiative.

s2.name: Specification
s2.p: JORAM provides full support to JMS 1.1:

ul.li: Unified interfaces for the Point-to-Point (PTP) and Publish/Subscribe (Pub/Sub) messaging models
AND still the semantically specific PTP and Pub/Sub interfaces
Full backward compatibility with JMS 1.0.2b compliant applications
Plus a timer for pending transacted sessions

s2.p: JORAM also implements the ASF interfaces and methods for performing JMS operations through an application server, and is integrated to JOnAS EJB platform.

s2.name: Getting involved
s2.p: Any input or personal view for improving and/or developing JORAM is welcome. JORAM, as an open source project, also welcomes external contributions. Interested? Contact us.
